intro: Ceratostema peruvianum, commonly known as the Peruvian horned bell, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as the knotweeds. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, horn-like bracts that encase its small, bell-shaped flowers. Ceratostema peruvianum typically grows in rocky or mountainous regions, preferring well-drained soils. Its unique morphology and native habitat make it a subject of interest in botanical studies and horticulture.
